FuncDef:
The ds-lite log session enable command enables DS-Lite flow and syslog log functions.
The undo ds-lite log session enable command disables DS-Lite flow and syslog log functions.
By default, DS-Lite flow and syslog log functions are disabled.
CLIs: ds-lite log session enable [ elog | syslog ]
undo ds-lite log session enable [ elog | syslog ]

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates session logs in the elog format.
-

Indicates session logs in the syslog format.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the flow log function is enabled and the DS-Lite session table ages, a device packages address translation information in time sequence in the session table and sends it to a specified flow log server.
Prerequisites
A flow or syslog log host has been configured using the ds-lite log host command.
Configuration Impact
A flow log is recorded for each flow.
Precautions
If value is set to 0 in the port range command run in the DS-Lite instance view, a device sends flow logs. If a non-0 value is set, the device sends syslog logs.
